title: Central Andean puna
text:
The Central Andean puna is a <a href="montane%20grasslands%20and%20shrublands">montane grasslands and shrublands</a> <a href="ecoregion">ecoregion</a> in the <a href="Andes">Andes</a> of southern <a href="Peru">Peru</a>, <a href="Bolivia">Bolivia</a>, and northern <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>.
Setting.
The landscape in this ecoregion consists of high mountains with permanent snow and ice, <a href="meadow">meadow</a>s, lakes, <a href="plateau">plateau</a>s, and valleys. It transitions to the <a href="Central%20Andean%20wet%20puna">Central Andean wet puna</a> to the north and the <a href="Central%20Andean%20dry%20puna">Central Andean dry puna</a> to the south. Elevations range from .
Climate.
The climate is <a href="K%C3%B6ppen%20climate%20classification">Köppen climate classification</a> <a href="Cold%20semi-arid%20climate%23Cold%20semi-arid%20climates">cold semi-arid</a>. Precipitation ranges from per year.
Flora.
Flora consists typically of open <a href="meadow">meadow</a>s with rocks, <a href="bunchgrass">bunchgrass</a>, <a href="herbaceous%20plant">herbs</a>, <a href="moss">moss</a>, and <a href="lichen">lichen</a>. Grasses are represented by the <a href="genus">genera</a> "<a href="Calamagrostis">Calamagrostis</a>", "<a href="Agrostis">Agrostis</a>", and "<a href="Festuca">Festuca</a>". "<a href="Parastrephia%20lepidophylla">Parastrephia lepidophylla</a>" and "<a href="Margyricarpus">Margyricarpus</a>" are small bush species found here. "<a href="Azorella%20compacta">Azorella compacta</a>" and "<a href="Puya%20raimondi">Puya raimondi</a>" are shared with the wet puna. "<a href="Polylepis">Polylepis</a>", "<a href="Buddleja">Buddleja</a>", and "<a href="Escallonia">Escallonia</a>" are trees found at lower elevations.
Fauna.
Darwin's rhea ("<a href="Pterocnemia%20pennata">Pterocnemia pennata</a>") and the puna mouse ("<a href="Punomys%20lemminus">Punomys lemminus</a>") are <a href="Endemism">endemic</a> bird and mammal species found here. Vicuña ("<a href="Vicugna%20vicugna">Vicugna vicugna</a>"), guanaco ("<a href="Lama%20guanicoe">Lama guanicoe</a>"), chinchilla ("<a href="Chinchilla%20brevicaudata">Chinchilla brevicaudata</a>"), and viscacha ("<a href="Lagidium">Lagidium</a>") are also present. Threatened bird species include the royal cinclodes ("<a href="Cinclodes%20aricomae">Cinclodes aricomae</a>"), the tamarugo conebill ("<a href="Conirostrum%20tamarugense">Conirostrum tamarugense</a>"), James's flamingo ("<a href="Phoenicopterus%20jamesi">Phoenicopterus jamesi</a>"), and the giant coot ("<a href="Fulica%20gigantea">Fulica gigantea</a>").
